column4: I don't think there is such thing as a 'gtk based' screensaver. You probably just want to install something like xscreensaver
It even gives you instruction on how to install that..
I know.. I did all the steps with no luck
I did all the steps with no "human" errors
I don't see any reason why it wouldn't work, thoguh I haven't tried it
can you try it if you have ubuntu 9.10, please?
I can't try it right now, but maybe later
It should be the default when you set it there. If it's resetting itself, you may have permissions problems in .gconf
I've checke it... no, permissions are fine
To fix it, you could try as you normal user, run 'sudo chown -R $USER ~/.gconf*' then set to None and back to Normal again then re-login. If it doesn't work, this is not your problem :)
chown is set to my username for all directories and files
I guess it's broken somewhere else then
